email.title: Weekly Digest

image.title: I was going to put snowman cookies but it didn't snow enough at all :(

email.text:
Hi everyone!
As IC Hack 19 approaches its final hours, we want to firstly thank all of our organisers and volunteers for making IC Hack 19 possible. We will have a live stream of the closing ceremony taking place today, with more details below.
Next week will be relatively quiet as we recover from the hackathon. However, we have a few opportunities from sponsors (both held in their offices!), introductions to DoCSoc CTF and Google Hash Code 2019!
email.heading: IC Hack 19 Closing Ceremony
email.text: As IC Hack comes to a close, you can tune into a livestream of the **closing ceremony from 3pm today**. Stay tuned on our social media channels for the YouTube link!
email.heading: DoCSoc CTF
email.text:
We run weekly sessions of "CTF dojos" every Wednesday afternoon (15:00 – 17:00). During our sessions we cover various cybersecurity related topics, including network and web security. We often participate in (rather challenging) CTFs during the weekend, which provide interesting challenges to dissect during the dojos as well.
If you have never heard of Capture The Flag (CTF) competitions, they are e ssentially challenges which require you to develop exploits or take advantage of vulnerabilities based on black-box analysis, source code analysis, forensic analysis, etc. These skills are very useful for your career and for courses like 331 Network and Web Security.
Here is a video introduction by a popular CTF channel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ev9ZX9J45A
If you are interested, please join our FB group, [DoCSoc CTF](https://www.facebook.com/groups/2422843637940223/).
email.heading: DoCSoc Hosts Google Hash Code 2019

event.text:
We’ll be hosting a hub at Imperial College London for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code, a team programming competition organized by Google.
The Online Qualification Round takes place on February 28th, 2019 at 17:30 UTC, and registered teams from are invited to participate from our hub, which will take place at Imperial College London RSM G01. Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will then be invited to Google’s office to compete in the Final Round of the competition in April.
If you’re interested in joining our hub, find a team (2 to 4 people) and be sure you all register at https://g.co/hashcode. You'll then need to select Imperial College London Hub United Kingdom from the list of hubs in the Judge System.

email.heading: Facebook Hack-a-project
email.text:
This is just a gentle reminder that we are **closing applications** for our 3rd run of **Hack-a-project on Feb 1st 2019**.
This is a 5-week mentoring programme kicking off in February 2019, designed for 1st years of a three year degree and 2nd years of a fourth year degree, looking to apply for a Software Engineering internship with Facebook. Selected students will come to the Facebook office, once a week in the evening to learn about the whole development cycle and build a project as a team via a hackathon!
Each session will also be catered, so come hungry (to learn and to eat!)
Please take a look at the video from our last Hack-a-project to find out more https://www.facebook.com/265781023507354/posts/2024153967670042/.
**If you are interested, please sign-up by following [this](https://hackaproject2019.splashthat.com/) link AND send your CV to LucyKemp@fb.com with the subject headline ‘Hack-a-project – applicant 2019’.**
email.heading: Discover Bloomberg

event.location: Bloomberg LP, 3 Queen Victoria Street, London, EC4N 4TQ
event.text:
Bloomberg Women in Technology are pleased to invite you to '**Discover Bloomberg**' on **6th February**.
**Bloomberg Women in Technology (BWIT)** is an employee network focused on encouraging increased participation of women and other underrepresented groups in technology. The goal of the community is to offer a strong support network, encourage community members to continuously pursue technical advancement and leadership, helping to inspire the next generation of girls in STEM.
Starting at 3pm, you will get a **tour of our fantastic office space**, gain insight into our Software Engineering department, and learn more about life at Bloomberg through **1-2-1 shadowing** with an engineer and our **panel discussion**. And, if this sparks your interest in a career at Bloomberg, our recruitment team will be on hand to talk to you about the Software Engineering positions available to you.
Spaces for this event are limited. We therefore ask you to complete the registration form by **28th January**. Spots will be confirmed on **31st January** and we will then reach out to you to arrange any travel assistance that you may need.
Please sign up via http://tinyurl.com/ydy8aaj4.

email.heading: Entrepreneur First - Future Outliers Workshop

event.location: Block L, The Biscuit Factory, 100 Drummond Road, SE16 4DG
event.text:
**Do you have the technical skills and ambition to build a deep tech company?**
Entrepreneur First and Imperial are hosting a _Future Outliers_ workshop series for 40 students interested in learning how to build a company from scratch. You'll get access to the same learning EF shares with the founders on their programme. If you want to build a world-changing company, but don't know where to start, apply here http://buff.ly/2W9ZFx6 by **February 2nd**.
The workshops will take place at **EF's London office** on 12th, 13th and 19th Feb from 6pm.
Please see the flyer attached for more information.
